data.title: Silence unused field warning in DamagedByTerrainInfo
data.body: This produces a warning in VS2015 Update 3. Explicit assignment silences the warning.

data.title: Multiply all damage and health values by 100 or 1000 in the nonD2K mods.
data.body:
One of the actual benefits of Dune 2000's arbitrarily huge health pools and damage values is to have more bits for the float-integer conversion during actual damage calculation, preventing issues like #11425 to happen.

I think it would be useful to add this D2k trait to the other mods as well (would give more freedom to balancers without triggering rounding-to-0 possibilities).

data.title: Forcing Concrete - option
data.body:
![concreteslab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/17137100/9add4d2a-5339-11e6-85c1-ea20362de197.jpg)

Concrete is a very important element of the dune-games ... as it (along with the deserts and building-islands) makes a huge portion of the difference between other rts-games like Tiberian Dawn and Red Alert ...  

while i was playing the new dune2-mod that's in development for OpenRA ... i realized that building concrete is putting you in disadvantage to a enemy that is not building concrete at all ... you can notice that when playing against the AI

part of me also thinks that this is a very aesthetic feature ... and i "hate" being forced to avoid using it in competitive games

so what the players are allowed , is to completely avoid a main-feature of dune-games ... and get an advantage out of it , by getting a boost for the economy and production in return ... which ultimately will lead to victory over a player that is carefully placing one concrete after another 

so my idea is ... that we add an option ... (off on default) ... to force people to build concrete .. otherwise they cant place buildings on the ground

this would put all players on the same starting-conditions without having them avoid a "main-aspect" of the dune-games ... and further more this could actually help defusing the early (and fast) trike/raider rushes ... as everyone should be able (in theory) to have the same amount of time  to produce counter - units

i discussed that already with @x-a-n-a-x and @MustaphaTR ... here : http://logs.openra.net/?year=2016&month=07&day=25#08:55:38

i would be actually interested especially on the opinion of @Nyerguds on this issue 

also @SoScared and @TheRaffy should add their mustard on this matter , as this option would effect both d2k and d2

data.title: OpenRA refuses to launch after detecting OpenGL 1.1 support despite system supporting OpenGL 2.1.
data.body:
OS: Windows 10, GPU: Intel Mobile 965 Express Chipset Family

OpenRA: release-20160508

Intel only officially supports OpenGL 1.1 on this GPU but it is simple to add unofficial support for OpenGL 2.1. This works for launching Minecraft 1.10.2, which requires OpenGL 2.1, and Minecraft 1.10.2 does not launch on the drivers Intel provides. However, OpenRA refuses to try to launch due to it incorrectly detecting the maximum OpenGL version. I am confident that if OpenRA skipped this check and launched anyway then it would work fine. 

A fix for this issue could simply be to check for the Intel Mobile 965 Express Chipset Family GPU and ignore whatever the detected OpenGL version is and instead assume that it is 2.1.

data.title: Crash when selling building - Desync in multiplayer
data.body: In bleed

data.title: Improved the Red Alert dog behavior
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7506. I redid this from scratch and tried to match RA95 behavior taking https://youtu.be/4ZyAlXOY0aM?t=2m for reference still avoiding legacy limitations.

Instead of leaping onto a targetable actor and killing everything in that cell, I separate leap movement and attack execution. This means the path finder now makes sure that an attack can be executed so jumping over cliffs and other glitches are gone.

The insta-kill is also not a hard-coded hack, but using the regular weapon system. This means we can also armor soldiers accordingly so they only take damage from a hit for a more fine grained balancing. For now the weapon is a high speed bullet like all the other melee attacks, but we can change this into a close combat "projectile" later on to avoid the overhead.

I also tried to adhere to our modular https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Actor-Upgrades system instead of putting everything into a monolithic one-purpose trait. The `UpgradeOnTarget` trait can be used to recreate http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Terrorist_(Generals) style units and I guess creative modders will find a lot of uses for `UpgradeOnAttack` I didn't even think of yet.

data.title: ChangeOwnerWarhead + UpgradeActorsNear crash
data.body:
Basically the game crashes if you use a ChangeOnwerWarhead on any actor that is under the effect of many UpgradeActorsNear auras. I've only tested this with a ChangeOnwerWarhead that has a limited time duration.

As a little explanation for the situation, the actor that provided the upgraded gave the mind control victim various upgrades, firepower, speed, and so on, once that unit is mind controlled, the game will crash when the unit goes back to it's original onwer.

I am not totally sure what caused the second crash, but it started to happen once I made the Mind Control unit unable to affect units upgraded by the conflicting buff.

The game stopped crashing once I disabled the mind control unit (tested three or four times).

data.title: Official Map Pool: Alter 21 maps' player spawns (letter order) and ore mines for minimap exposure.
data.body:
I went through the map pool and picked up a few maps that currently is unlikely to be affected by any change in the official map pool (e.g. #11143). It's just a reorganizing of the player spawns' letters (and some minor adjustments) that are mostly aesthetic but will make it easier for players to set up teams in the lobby.

Most of the erroneous player spawns are due to a bug (fixed in the next playtest/release - #11125) in the editor that sometimes scrambles the order of the letters when saving/exiting, or possibly old maps that was made before letters were introduced to the spawns. Regardless, here are some fixes:

**Forest Path**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15209/
![forest path compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076633/f325d1d4-50b7-11e6-884b-d1b7ce284f76.png)

**Bad Neighbors**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15207/
![bad neighbors compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076644/0ee467b4-50b8-11e6-9e95-a1848d2dd544.png)

**Mad Science**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15211/

![haos ridges compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076706/58c9422c-50b9-11e6-9e2e-8a72f8440b1a.png)

**Vegetation**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15239/

data.title: Dedicated-server-crash on raspberry pi 3
data.body:
Raspbian Jessie
release.20160508 

i took all the necessary steps in order to make it work from : 
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/OpenRA-on-RaspberryPi

with the only difference that i added the current release-numbers here : 
wget https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/releases/download/release-20160508/openra_release.20160508_all.deb

and here : 
sudo dpkg -i openra_release.20160508_all.deb 

when i tried to run "my-dedicated.sh" it crashed :
Unhandled Exception:
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Network.UPnP.ForwardPort (Int32 lifetime) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Server.Server..ctor (System.Net.IPEndPoint endpoint, OpenRA.ServerSettings settings, OpenRA.ModData modData, Boolean dedicated) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Server.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Network.UPnP.ForwardPort (Int32 lifetime) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Server.Server..ctor (System.Net.IPEndPoint endpoint, OpenRA.ServerSettings settings, OpenRA.ModData modData, Boolean dedicated) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Server.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
[2016-07-23T13:46:33] Starting dedicated server for mod: ra
